news.title: Europe is in a ‘fight for our future’ after Russian drones fly into Poland, von der Leyen says
Micheál Martin dealt blow as Fianna Fáil TDs revolt over choice of Jim Gavin for Áras
news.summary: Taoiseach Micheál Martin has been delivered a shot across the bow from Fianna Fáil backbenchers after the vote on the party’s presidential nomination was tighter than expected.

news.title: Director of equestrian centre agrees to hand over valuable horses at centre of dispute
news.summary: A director of an equestrian centre who took away six valuable sports horses last month is to give up possession of the bloodstock pending the determination of a dispute between him and his former girlfriend, who owns the business.

news.title: Dublin Airport apologises after overcharging 4,500 car park customers – here’s how you will get full refund and additional discount
news.summary: Dublin Airport operator DAA has apologised after a “pricing system error” led to 4,500 customers being overcharged a total of €25,000 while using its parking facilities earlier this year.

news.title: Leaking ceiling, ‘rotting floorboards’ and lack of fire alarms: Oasis fan’s ‘shocking’ Airbnb experience in an alleged illegal let
news.summary: An Oasis fan who rented an Airbnb ­property in Dublin for €700 a night has called on the letting website to do more to protect the safety of guests after her “shocking experience” in an alleged illegal let.

news.title: Controversial landlord Marc Godart gets court go-ahead for Dublin pub takeover
news.summary: Controversial landlord Marc Godart has been allowed to take over a Dublin pub's licence after a judge noted he had received approval from a city fire officer.

news.title: Explainer: Nato Articles 4 and 5, could Ukraine war trigger alliance defence obligations?
news.summary: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk said on Wednesday he had asked Nato to open consultations under Article 4 of the alliance's treaty after Poland shot down drones in its airspace following what he called a "large-scale provocation" by Russia.

news.title: Why limited crowds likely as Trump International Doonbeg confirmed as 2026 Amgen Irish Open host
news.summary: President Donald Trump’s Doonbeg resort will host the 2026 Amgen Irish Open but crowds are likely to be limited at the Co Clare venue when it stages the event from September 10-13.

news.title: Tanya Sweeney: The trolls attacking The Traitors’ villain Eamon O’Keeffe are ruining the spirit of the show
news.summary: You may have heard of  The Traitors Ireland . You may well be one of the 600,000-odd people who tuned in to the first episode on RTÉ One and have been glued ever since.

news.title: Heimir Hallgrimsson on Ireland players: ‘They are not as confident as they should be in my opinion. They probably carried something from the past’
news.summary: Heimir Hallgrimsson has called on Ireland fans to support the players instead of turning on them in the inevitable backlash following Tuesday evening’s humiliation in Armenia.
